wikipedia_page.main: William Garthshore FRSE (1764–1806) was an English politician, a Member of Parliament from 1795 to 1806.

link_mentions.page: List of Lords Commissioners of the Admiralty
Weymouth and Melcombe Regis (UK Parliament constituency)

response: His first wife, who brought him the small estate of Ruscoe in Kirkcudbrightshire, died in 1765, leaving him one son surviving. His second wife, Mrs. Murrel, whom he married in 1795, died some years before him. The Member of Parliament William Garthshore was his son.
